message:
Guys anyone had a previous problem with thomas cook card with digitalocean?!
Every time i try to add it as a payment method it always refuses and locks my account!!!
Also do you have an alternative for a reasonable price dedicated linux server?!

data.message: i've tried every single way to contact them and they did not respond and this is driving me crazy. their support was even better than this!!
Tab why don't you use PayPal?
it's like u charge ur account when u use paypal and they take from it each month :D
tyb 5leena n3ml paypal account w nshoof
i got an error msg "We are unable to confirm this credit card.". i think it's an issue with my card :/

It might not be the solution to your problem but it's still worth sharing. I once hard trouble making payments on Godaddy several years ago. Turns out they blocked payments from abroad. I used a free  VPN while visiting the website to make it look like I'm from the US and it worked!
Linode.com is a good alternative to DO

they don't accept "prepaid" visa/mastercard cards.
you should use paypal

I've been using my CIB TomathCook (prepaid) Card for a long time now with DO and it's working just fine (even CIB sends me an SMS everytime anyone deduces any amount from my card) :) --it's also working with google app engine and name silo :) 

and yes Omar's point is very valid, I've tried paying with it while tunneling my traffic through a Netherlands server and didn't work because the shop I was paying refused it :)
I haven't tried it but I think vultr.com would be a good alternative. And linode ofcourse.

I find the idea of entering credit card info while using a free vpn very scary, I think there are at least some kinds of ssl (ip-based i think) that has to be decrypted then re-encrypted by the VPN, so I woldn't personally do that besara7a :D
(if it's perfectly safe, correct me :D)

it was a problem with thomas cook, i've tried linode and it accepted the payment. Godady too has accepted the payment. vultr and digital ocean have refused it. that Omar Youssef for such suggestion ;)
